00027 /// Default maximum Message data area size
00028 /// @private @memberof Message
00029 enum MaxMsgBodySizeDefault
00030 {
00031    MAX_MSG_BODY_SIZE_DEFAULT = 256
00032 };
00033 
00034 /// For identification in the log file
00035 /// @private @memberof Message
00036 static char sourceID[] = "ZMS";

00038 /// Actual maximum Message body size
00039 /// @private @memberof Message

00046 /** Retrieves the data area of a Message.
00047

00049     message : the Message that is being queried

00052     the data area of the Message
00053

00056 
00057 TC2API char* message_buffer(Message* message)
00058 {
00059    assert(message);
00060    return message->body;
00061 }

00063 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00065 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00066 
00067 /** Returns one byte from the message body.
00068 
00069     @param [in]
00070     srcMsg : source Message
00071 
00072     @param [in]
00073     msgOffset : offset into source Message buffer from where to copy byte
00074 
00075     @return
00076     one byte
00077 
00078     @memberof Message
00079 */
00080 
00081 TC2API uchar message_byte(const Message* srcMsg, ushort msgOffset)
00082 {
00083    log_func(message_byte);
00084 
00085    if (!srcMsg)
00086    {
00087       log_ferror("source message is null");
00088       return 0xFF;
00089    }
00090 
00091    if (msgOffset >= srcMsg->size)
00092    {
00093       log_ferror("invalid message offset: %d", msgOffset);
00094       return 0xFF;
00095    }
00096 
00097    return *((srcMsg->body) + msgOffset);
00098 }

00100 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00102 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103 
00104 /** Clones fields from one message to another.
00105 
00106     Usage: @code
00107     message_cloneFields(dstMsg, srcMsg, nFields,
00108       offset1, size1,
00109       offset2, size2,
00110       etc
00111       );
00112     @endcode
00113 
00114     @param
00115     dstMsg : destination Message
00116 
00117     @param [in]
00118     srcMsg : source Message
00119 
00120     @param [in]
00121     nFields : number of fields to copy
00122 
00123     @pre
00124     both dstMsg and srcMsg must have valid sizes (see #message_setSize)
00125 
00126     @memberof Message
00127 */
00128 
00129 TC2API void message_cloneFields(Message* dstMsg, const Message* srcMsg,
00130    ushort nFields, ... ) // int offset, int size
00131 
00132 {
00133    ushort i;
00134    va_list ap;
00135    int offset, size; 
00136    char *srcAddr, *dstAddr;
00137 
00138    log_func(message_cloneFields);
00139 
00140    if (!srcMsg)
00141    {
00142       log_ferror("source message is null");
00143       return;
00144    }
00145 
00146    if (!dstMsg)
00147    {
00148       log_ferror("destination address is null");
00149       return;
00150    }
00151 
00152    va_start(ap, nFields);
00153 
00154    for (i = 0; i < nFields; i++)
00155    {
00156       offset = va_arg(ap, int); 
00157       if (offset >= dstMsg->size)
00158       {
00159          log_ferror("invalid message offset: %d", offset);
00160          return;
00161       }
00162 
00163       size = va_arg(ap, int); 
00164       if (size > srcMsg->size - offset || size > dstMsg->size - offset)
00165       {
00166          log_ferror("invalid copy size: %d", size);
00167          return;
00168       }
00169 
00170       srcAddr = (char*)(srcMsg->body) + offset;
00171       dstAddr = (char*)(dstMsg->body) + offset;
00172       memcpy(dstAddr, srcAddr, size);
00173    } // for
00174 }
00175 
00176 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00177 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00178 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00179 
00180 /** Compares data from an application buffer with the message body.
00181 
00182     Usage: @code
00183     int result = message_compareToMessage(buffer, message, offset, size);
00184     @endcode
00185 
00186     @param [in]
00187     srcAddr1 : first operand of comparison
00188 
00189     @param [in]
00190     srcMsg2 : second operand of comparison 
00191 
00192     @param [in]
00193     msgOffset : offset into destination Message buffer where to begin compare
00194 
00195     @param [in]
00196     size : number of bytes to compare
00197 
00198     @return
00199     like memcmp: -1, 0, 1
00200 
00201     @pre
00202     srcMsg2 must have valid size (see #message_setSize)
00203 
00204     @memberof Message
00205 */
00206 
00207 TC2API int message_compareToMessage(cchar* srcAddr1, const Message* srcMsg2, 
00208    ushort msgOffset, ushort size)
00209 {
00210    char* srcAddr2;
00211    log_func(message_compareToMessage);
00212 
00213    if (!srcAddr1)
00214    {
00215       log_ferror("source address 1 is null");
00216       return -1; // tries to be consistent
00217    }
00218 
00219    if (!srcMsg2)
00220    {
00221       log_ferror("source Message 2 is null");
00222       return 1;  // tries to be consistent 
00223    }
00224 
00225    if (msgOffset >= srcMsg2->size)
00226    {
00227       log_ferror("invalid message 2 offset: %d", msgOffset);
00228       return 1;  // tries (a little harder) to be consistent 
00229    }
00230 
00231    if (size > (srcMsg2->size - msgOffset))
00232    {
00233       log_ferror("invalid compare size: %d", size);
00234       return 1; // tries (a little more harder) to be consistent  
00235    }
00236 
00237    srcAddr2 = (char*)(srcMsg2->body) + msgOffset;
00238    return memcmp(srcAddr1, srcAddr2, size);
00239 }
00240 
00241 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00242 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00243 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00244 
00245 /** Copies fields from one message to another.
00246 
00247     Usage: @code
00248     message_copyFields(dstMsg, srcMsg, nFields,
00249       dstOffset1, srcOffset1, size1,
00250       dstOffset2, srcOffset2, size2,
00251       etc
00252       );
00253     @endcode
00254 
00255     @param
00256     dstMsg : destination Message
00257 
00258     @param [in]
00259     srcMsg : source Message
00260 
00261     @param [in]
00262     nFields : number of fields to copy
00263 
00264     @pre
00265     both dstMsg and srcMsg must have valid sizes (see #message_setSize)
00266 
00267     @memberof Message
00268 */
00269 
00270 TC2API void message_copyFields(Message* dstMsg, const Message* srcMsg,
00271    ushort nFields, ... ) // int msgOffDst, int msgOffSrc, int size
00272 {
00273    ushort i;
00274    va_list ap;
00275    char *srcAddr, *dstAddr;
00276    int msgOffDst, msgOffSrc, size; 
00277 
00278    log_func(message_copyFields);
00279 
00280    if (!srcMsg)
00281    {
00282       log_ferror("source message is null");
00283       return;
00284    }
00285 
00286    if (!dstMsg)
00287    {
00288       log_ferror("destination address is null");
00289       return;
00290    }
00291 
00292    va_start(ap, nFields);
00293 
00294    for (i = 0; i < nFields; i++)
00295    {
00296       msgOffDst = va_arg(ap, int); 
00297       if (msgOffDst >= dstMsg->size)
00298       {
00299          log_ferror("invalid dest message offset: %d", msgOffDst);
00300          return;
00301       }
00302 
00303       msgOffSrc = va_arg(ap, int); 
00304       if (msgOffSrc >= srcMsg->size)
00305       {
00306          log_ferror("invalid source message offset: %d", msgOffSrc);
00307          return;
00308       }
00309 
00310       size = va_arg(ap, int); 
00311       if (size > srcMsg->size - msgOffSrc || size > dstMsg->size - msgOffDst)
00312       {
00313          log_ferror("invalid copy size: %d", size);
00314          return;
00315       }
00316 
00317       srcAddr = (char*)(srcMsg->body) + msgOffSrc;
00318       dstAddr = (char*)(dstMsg->body) + msgOffDst;
00319       memcpy(dstAddr, srcAddr, size);
00320    } // for
00321 }

00341

00344

00347 
00348     @memberof Message
00349 */
00350 
00351 TC2API void message_copyFromMessage(char* dstAddr, const Message* srcMsg,
00352    ushort msgOffset, ushort size)
00353 {
00354    char* srcAddr;
00355    log_func(message_copyFromMessage);
00356 
00357    if (!srcMsg)
00358    {
00359       log_ferror("source message is null");
00360       return;
00361    }
00362 
00363    if (!dstAddr)
00364    {
00365       log_ferror("destination address is null");
00366       return;
00367    }
00368 
00369    if (msgOffset >= srcMsg->size)
00370    {
00371       log_ferror("invalid message offset: %d", msgOffset);
00372       return;
00373    }
00374 
00375    if (size > (srcMsg->size - msgOffset))
00376    {
00377       log_ferror("invalid copy size: %d", size);
00378       return;
00379    }
00380 
00381    srcAddr = (char*)(srcMsg->body) + msgOffset;
00382    memcpy(dstAddr, srcAddr, size);

00447 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00448 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00449 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00450 
00451 /** Creates a Message structure.
00452 
00453     @param [in]
00454     flags : flags to be applied to the Message
00455 
00456     @return
00457     address of the Message structure just created
00458 
00459     @memberof Message
00460 */
00461 
00462 TC2API Message* message_create(ushort flags)
00463 {
00464    Message* message;
00465 
00466    log_func(message_create);
00467    log_finfo("creating a message with flags %04X", flags);
00468 
00469    message= (Message*) calloc(1, sizeof(Message)+maxBodySize+1);
00470    // +maxBodySize: accounts for the body data area
00471    // +1:           accounts for message suffix
00472    assert(message);
00473 
00474    message->flags |= flags;
00475    message->prefix = MSG_PREFIX;
00476 
00477    // not yet known!
00478    // *(message->body + message->size) = MSG_SUFFIX;
00479 
00480    return message;
00481 }

00483 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00484 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00485 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486 
00487 /** Fills message body with a character.
00488 
00489     Usage: @code
00490     message_fill(dstMsg, ch, msgOffset, size);
00491     @endcode
00492 
00493     @param [out]
00494     dstMsg : destination Message
00495 
00496     @param [in]
00497     ch : character to be used for filling
00498 
00499     @param [in]
00500     msgOffset : offset into destination Message buffer where to begin fill
00501 
00502     @param [in]
00503     size : number of bytes to fill
00504 
00505     @remark like <i>memset</i>
00506 
00507     @pre
00508     dstMsg must have valid size (see #message_setSize)
00509 
00510     @memberof Message
00511 */
00512 
00513 TC2API void message_fill(const Message* dstMsg, char ch, ushort msgOffset,
00514    ushort size)
00515 {
00516    char* dstAddr;
00517    log_func(message_fill);
00518 
00519    if (!dstMsg)
00520    {
00521       log_ferror("destination message is null");
00522       return;
00523    }
00524 
00525    if (msgOffset >= dstMsg->size)
00526    {
00527       log_ferror("invalid destination message offset: %d", msgOffset);
00528       return;
00529    }
00530 
00531    if (size > (dstMsg->size - msgOffset))
00532    {
00533       log_ferror("invalid compare fill: %d", size);
00534       return;
00535    }
00536 
00537    dstAddr = (char*)(dstMsg->body) + msgOffset;
00538    memset(dstAddr, ch, size);
00539 }

00661 TC2API uint message_isValidSuffix(const Message* message)
00662 {

00730 /** Sets one byte in the message body with a byte from the application.
00731 
00732     @param [out]
00733     dstMsg : destination Message
00734 
00735     @param [in]
00736     msgOffset : offset into destination Message buffer where to copy byte
00737 
00738     @param [in]
00739     byte : byte being copy into the message
00740 
00741     @remark like msg[offset] = byte;
00742 
00743     @pre
00744     dstMsg must have valid size (see #message_setSize)
00745 
00746     @memberof Message
00747 */
00748 
00749 TC2API void message_setByte(const Message* dstMsg, ushort msgOffset, uchar byte)
00750 {
00751    log_func(message_setByte);
00752 
00753    if (!dstMsg)
00754    {
00755       log_ferror("destination message is null");
00756       return;
00757    }
00758 
00759    if (msgOffset >= dstMsg->size)
00760    {
00761       log_ferror("invalid message offset: %d", msgOffset);
00762       return;
00763    }
00764 
00765    *(uchar*)((dstMsg->body) + msgOffset) = byte;
00766 }

00829 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00830 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00831 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00832 
00833 /** Sets the size of the Message data area.
00834 
00835     @param
00836     message : the Message that is being modified
00837 
00838     @param [in]
00839     size : size to be used for the data area of this Message
00840 
00841     @memberof Message
00842 */
00843 
00844 TC2API void message_setSize(const Message* message, ushort size)
00845 {
00846    log_func(message_setSize);
00847 
00848    if (!message)
00849    {
00850       log_ferror("message is null!");
00851       return;
00852    }
00853 
00854    if (message->prefix != MSG_PREFIX)
00855    {
00856       log_ferror("message with invalid prefix %02X!", (uchar)(message->prefix));
00857       return;
00858    }
00859 
00860    if (size > maxBodySize)
00861    {
00862       log_ferror("invalid size %d!", size);
00863       size = maxBodySize;
00864    }
00865 
00866    ((Message*)message)->size = size;
00867    *(char*)(message->body + size) = MSG_SUFFIX;
00868 }
00869

00896 
00897     @param [in]
00898     message : the Message that is being queried
00899 
00900     @return
00901     the size of the data area of this Message
00902 
00903     @memberof Message
00904 */
00905 
00906 TC2API uint message_size(const Message* message)
00907 {
00908    assert(message);
00909    return message->size;
00910 }

00916 /** Retrieves the size of the part 1 of a Message being received.

00978 /** Retrieves the address of on-the-wire contents of this Message.

00988 
00989 TC2API char* message_start(Message* message)

00995 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00996 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00997 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00998 
00999 /** Retrives the message suffix.
01000 
01001     @param [in]
01002     message : the Message that is being queried
01003 
01004     @return
01005     the message suffix
01006 
01007     @memberof Message
01008 */
01009 
01010 TC2API char message_suffix(Message* message)
01011 {
01012    assert(message);
01013    return  (*(message->body + message->size)); 
01014 }
